Class main.ElevatorCommandCenter

java.lang.Object
main.ElevatorCommandCenter
public class main.ElevatorCommandCenter extends Object
The Elevator command center controls the entire main.elevator system in the building. It manages the elevators, the requests and utilizes multithreading.
Author:
Arthur Kaplan

    printMsgCurrentFloorIsNotZero(Elevator main.elevator)

    void
    start()
    This method calls the processRequests() method for as long as there are unfulfilled requests in the main.request list.
    Processing of requests starts after 1 second to ensure that the while loop is not exited before the main.request list can be filled.

  • Constructor Details

    • main.ElevatorCommandCenter

  • Method Details

    • addRequest

      public void addRequest(Request main.request) throws ElevatorException
      Adds a main.request to the list of Requests.
      Parameters:
      main.request - the main.request to be added
      Throws:
      ElevatorException - the main.elevator main.exception which is thrown when the main.request cannot be added.

    • start

      public void start()
      This method calls the processRequests() method for as long as there are unfulfilled requests in the main.request list.
      Processing of requests starts after 1 second to ensure that the while loop is not exited before the main.request list can be filled. It also has an inbuilt delay between each main.request.

    • processRequests

      public void processRequests()
      Processes requests in a new Thread. Depending on the main.request's starting floor, a different message is displayed on the command line. After a main.request is completed, the main.elevator is no longer in use and can fulfill another main.request.

    • printMsgCurrentFloorIsNotZero

      private void printMsgCurrentFloorIsNotZero(Elevator main.elevator)
      This message is printed to the command line if the current floor if anything other than the ground floor.
      Parameters:
      main.elevator - required to get the main.elevator's current floor, destination, and direction

    • printMsgCurrentFloorIsZero

      private void printMsgCurrentFloorIsZero(Elevator main.elevator)
      This message is printed to the command line if the main.elevator is currently on the ground floor.
      Parameters:
      main.elevator - required to get the main.elevator's current floor, destination, and direction

    • printMsgRequestIsComplete

      private void printMsgRequestIsComplete(Elevator main.elevator)
      This message is printed when a main.request has been completed, i.e. when the main.elevator reaches its destination.
      Parameters:
      main.elevator - required to get the main.elevator's number and current floor
